books.title: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
books.author: J.K. Rowling
books.description: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone is the first novel in the Harry Potter series, written by British author J.K. Rowling.

books.title: The Lord of the Rings
books.author: J.R.R. Tolkien
books.description: The Lord of the Rings is an epic high-fantasy novel by English author J.R.R. Tolkien, set in the world of Middle-earth.

books.author: George Orwell
books.description: 1984 is a dystopian novel by English author George Orwell, depicting a totalitarian regime.

books.title: Pride and Prejudice
books.author: Jane Austen
books.description: Pride and Prejudice is a romantic novel by Jane Austen, first published in 1813.

books.title: To Kill a Mockingbird
books.author: Harper Lee
books.description: To Kill a Mockingbird is a novel by Harper Lee, published in 1960. It deals with themes of racial injustice and moral growth.

books.title: The Catcher in the Rye
books.author: J.D. Salinger
books.description: The Catcher in the Rye is a novel by J.D. Salinger, first published in 1951. It follows teenager Holden Caulfield's experiences in New York City.

books.title: The Great Gatsby
books.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
books.description: The Great Gatsby is a novel by F. Scott Fitzgerald, set in the Jazz Age on Long Island, New York.

books.title: The Chronicles of Narnia
books.author: C.S. Lewis
books.description: The Chronicles of Narnia is a series of seven fantasy novels by C.S. Lewis, set in the fictional realm of Narnia.

books.title: Dune
books.author: Frank Herbert
books.description: Dune is a science fiction novel by American author Frank Herbert, set in the distant future amidst a sprawling interstellar society.

books.title: The Da Vinci Code
books.author: Dan Brown
books.description: The Da Vinci Code is a mystery thriller novel by Dan Brown, featuring symbologist Robert Langdon.
